page.title: 01DALBEATTIE AND DISTRICT
page.content: {Dalbeattie}is a small town of around 3800 population.Situated in S.West Scotland in the region of{Dumfries and {Galloway,}it lies in the valley of the River Urr.The name "Dalbeattie" is said to mean "valley of the birches". There are a few birch trees to be seen now but the hills around the town are covered mainly by pine,fir and spruce trees.Most of the land in the area is farmed.The town is a popular attraction for tourists, having a beautiful public park as well as facilities for football,golf,tennis and bowls.It is a short distance from the Solway coast where there are sandy beaches,fishing and yachting to enjoy. The local creamery has won many awards in national competitions for its high quality cheese.A firm making steel radiators is the major employer in the district.
